channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Russia launches record aerial attack on Ukraine
item.description: Russia launched the largest aerial assault on Ukraine overnight since the beginning of the full-scale invasion, according to the Ukrainian Air Force.
item.content:encoded:
Russia launched the largest aerial assault on Ukraine overnight since the beginning of the full-scale invasion, according to the Ukrainian Air Force.

(Image credit: Gavriil Grigorov)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Trump calls for Gaza deal, slams Netanyahu trial
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday pleaded for progress in ceasefire talks in the war in Gaza, calling for a deal, and doubled down on his criticism of the legal proceedings against Netanyahu.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday pleaded for progress in ceasefire talks in the war in Gaza, calling for a deal, and doubled down on his criticism of the legal proceedings against Netanyahu.

(Image credit: Ariel Schalit)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who said that? NPR's approach to anonymous sources
item.description: Sometimes people with vital information face serious risks for speaking to a journalist. In those cases, NPR may consider granting the source anonymity. Here's how we think about it.
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes people with vital information face serious risks for speaking to a journalist. In those cases, NPR may consider granting the source anonymity. Here's how we think about it.

(Image credit: Richard Drury)
item.dc:creator: Meghan Ashford-Grooms

item.title: Say 'maybe' to the dress? Tariffs are crashing the wedding planning party
item.description: How much extra would you pay to see your dream come true? It's always a big question for wedding-planning couples. Now, there's a new twist courtesy of U.S. trade policy.
item.content:encoded:
How much extra would you pay to see your dream come true? It's always a big question for wedding-planning couples. Now, there's a new twist courtesy of U.S. trade policy.

(Image credit: Becca Haugen/Twelve Ten Photography
)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: The Trump administration is building a national citizenship data system
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security, with help from DOGE, has rolled out a tool that purports to be able to check the citizenship status of almost all Americans.
item.content:encoded: The Department of Homeland Security, with help from DOGE, has rolled out a tool that purports to be able to check the citizenship status of almost all Americans.
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Northern Irish rap group Kneecap plays Glastonbury despite controversy
item.description: Irish-language rap group Kneecap gave an impassioned performance for tens of thousands of fans on Saturday at the Glastonbury Festival despite criticism by British politicians and a terror charge for one of the trio.
item.content:encoded:
Irish-language rap group Kneecap gave an impassioned performance for tens of thousands of fans on Saturday at the Glastonbury Festival despite criticism by British politicians and a terror charge for one of the trio.

(Image credit: Scott A Garfitt)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Kisses yes, Bezos No,' protesters say, as Bezos wedding stirs controversy in Venice
item.description: Protesters denounced the three-day celebrations for the wedding between Jeff Bezos and his wife Lauren Sanchez Bezos as a symbol of rising inequality and disregard for the city's residents.
item.content:encoded:
Protesters denounced the three-day celebrations for the wedding between Jeff Bezos and his wife Lauren Sanchez Bezos as a symbol of rising inequality and disregard for the city's residents.

(Image credit: Antonio Calanni/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Around 100,000 march in Budapest Pride event in defiance of Hungary's ban
item.description: Marchers gambled with potential police intervention and fines to participate in the annual Budapest Pride, which was outlawed by a law passed by Prime Minister Viktor Orbán's right-wing governing party.
item.content:encoded:
Marchers gambled with potential police intervention and fines to participate in the annual Budapest Pride, which was outlawed by a law passed by Prime Minister Viktor Orbán's right-wing governing party.

(Image credit: Rudolf Karancsi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: J.M. Smucker plans to remove artificial colors from its jams and other products
item.description: Smucker joins a growing number of big food companies that have announced plans to eliminate artificial dyes.
item.content:encoded:
Smucker joins a growing number of big food companies that have announced plans to eliminate artificial dyes.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Man kicked and injured a CBP beagle during airport baggage search
item.description: An Egyptian traveler who kicked the 25-pound dog was ordered to pay its vet fees and turn himself in for removal from the country.
item.content:encoded:
An Egyptian traveler who kicked the 25-pound dog was ordered to pay its vet fees and turn himself in for removal from the country.

(Image credit: CBP Office of Field Operations/Facebook)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise
